TopicTitle: Solved:Problem with Fuel Transfer across Rockomax Decoupler

Articles.Content:
I have a station and a ship docked by the small docking ports. I am able to transfer monopropellant. the problem comes when I try to transfer liquid fuel or oxidizer. there is a rockomax decoupler 2.5 on the ship. I thought it might be the crossfeed not being on, but that made no difference. I can transfer fuel between the two tanks on the station.

This version 1.2 no mods on windows 10.

Anyone have any suggestion or similar problems?

Edited October 14, 2016 by AlanP

31 minutes ago, AlanP said:

I have a station and a ship docked by the small docking ports. I am able to transfer monopropellant. the problem comes when I try to transfer liquid fuel or oxidizer. there is a rockomax decoupler 2.5 on the ship. I thought it might be the crossfeed not being on, but that made no difference. I can transfer fuel between the two tanks on the station.

This version 1.2 no mods on windows 10.

Anyone have any suggestion or similar problems?

transferring fuel manually doesn't care about crossfeed settings.  You should be able to transfer fuel regardless.

A quick test here shows it should be working, are you getting any errors in the debug screen?

If you could look here and post your logs that would help a lot.

I have the same problem.

It appears to be the heat shields that are causing the issue (all 3 stock ones)

 

Just did a quick test on the launch pad, the problem is the heat shield.
I will try with the decoupler and the heatsheild to see which it is and make a bug report.

@sal_vager I just tried it on the launch pad.

Cann't recreate in sandbox.

Recreated in sandbox only affects liquid fuel and Oxidizer, no monopropellant. heatshield and decoupler  cause same problem.

submitting bug report now.

Guys, heat shields do not have fuel crossfeed, it is in the info panel for the parts so you will need a fuel line to allow transferring fuel through them.

RCS and EC use the 'all vessel' rule so can feed from anywhere.

@sal_vager so your telling me that when I dock a ship to a station I need fuel lines to transfer fuel to it if it has a heatshield or decoupler?

we are not talking about burn but alt-right click to transfer fuel. It works in sandbox.

reported Bug #13008

similar to Bug #13004

Edited October 14, 2016 by AlanP

20 minutes ago, AlanP said:

@sal_vager so your telling me that when I dock a ship to a station I need fuel lines to transfer fuel to it if it has a heatshield or decoupler?

reported Bug #13008

I don't know how you managed to infer that from my post, I said "heat shields do not have fuel crossfeed, it is in the info panel for the parts so you will need a fuel line to allow transferring fuel through them"

Which can be seen here.

You can also disable 'Resource transfer obeys crossfeed rules' in the mini menu, advanced panel, yes this is a feature, please take a look at the changelog for 1.2

The relevant part is this.

Quote

Resource transfer in flight can be set to require valid crossfeed for those resources which obey crossfeed.

As the heat shields do not allow fuel crossfeed for those resources (LiquidFuel and Oxidiser) you will need this option.

 

Disabling that will allow you to transfer your fuel.

@sal_vager wow, I did not realize that. Thanks. Why does the mono transfer?

That will make ships a lot more challenging.

Yeah it will be a pain on old craft, and mono uses a different rule that ignores crossfeed limitations.

Though when you're building a new craft or fixing an old one in the VAB or SPH, if you run a fuel line from the vessel to the heat shield it'll add crossfeed to it, so it'll then pass to the docking ports.
@sal_vager Thank you very much. I'd feel like an idiot, but there are so many changes. you guys did too much this time. thanks for all the hard work and pass it on to the rest of the people.

I'm glad I was able to help, there's so many little changes to 1.2 it's hard to keep up with them, so many things are togglable now from navball behaviour to commnet ground stations to fuel flow.

It'll take some time to explore all the options.
